recentChanges: SoundCheck has been updated for improved performance. We have added an integrated sound level meter to measure noisy environments. Plus, we have included a toll-free number to call and schedule an appointment for a free hearing consultation.
comments: Doesn't check hearing beyond 4khz. You cannot decide which tones to do first. Is set on a predetermined sequence that cannot be corrected as you go if you think you messed up. There are far better apps for this.
It doesn't work with Samsung S10 android system.

This can test hearing and current noise levels. Smart, easy, and simple!....     AND YOU CAN DO IT YOURSELF FOR FREE!!!   ...Nice!!   I used to play in metalcore and punk bands and listen to very loud music for long periods of time. Lately, I've been questioning my ability to hear. This app was my first test since I was half my age, in my teens.

My son had severe ear infections  and the doctor said he might experience hearing loss until it clears completely up. This was a great app to check his hearing, I was so worried if it caused permanent hearing loss.
Does not ask for personal info! Use decent ear buds for isolation in an extremely quiet room for best results. Alleviated fear of high frequency hearing loss. I feel MUCH better.

title: Tinnitus Relief
description:
Tinnitus relief is an app designed for anyone suffering from tinnitus. 

Tinnitus relief contains a fact sheet describing what tinnitus is, how common it is, possible causes and what might make the condition worse. The mechanisms behind hypersensitivity to sound are also explained. It provides exercises and advice to help you cope with your tinnitus in the best possible way.

The app includes guided exercises you can use straight away:

• A 6-minute relaxation exercise
• A 25-minute body scan, which is an exercise in mindfulness that also provides relaxation 
• A 12-minute “sleep ease” exercise that will help you settle down and sleep. 

The more you do the Tinnitus Relief exercises, the easier you will find it to relax, and your tension and anxiety will recede. You will be able to concentrate better and a serene, positive mindset can take root. 

Tinnitus relief will also provide relief for anyone with a history of tinnitus, but where the situation has become more troublesome for some reason. In addition, you can apply the measures in this app in preventive manner, to protect against hearing loss and tinnitus. 

It can be greatly distressing when tinnitus first presents itself. This may be expressed as sleepless nights, concentration difficulties, tension, irritability and restlessness. The resulting stress could result in an even greater focus on the tinnitus. In my experience, the sooner you can break this vicious cycle, the better. Your tinnitus will bother you less, and the symptoms will recede and may even disappear. 

Tinnitus relief is conceptualized by Helena Löwen-Åberg, certified physiotherapist with a Masters degree. In addition to specialist competence in the areas of psychiatry and psychosomatics, she is a cognitive behavioural therapist, a professional supervisor and a mindfulness instructor.

Based in Gothenburg, Sweden, Ms. Löwen-Åberg deals with stress-related conditions such as tension-related disorders, tinnitus, vertigo, anxiety, pain, and sleep disorders. 

She has extensive experience of teaching relaxation and stress management with a cognitive approach. And gives mindfulness classes, as well as other wellness seminars and lectures.

In connection with the English version, Anja Bergh translated the exercises and that’s her voice you hear, while Ingrid Eng translated and edited the written material.  

Helena Löwen-Åberg

Explanation for permissions:
Network communication and Storage for downloading and installing of Tinnitus Relief exercises

title: How to Improve Hearing
description:
How to Improve Your Hearing - A Quick Way to Boost Your Hearing, If you've been experiencing hearing loss, you know how stressful it makes some situations. Hearing tests, important conversations, and watching your favorite TV show can become an ordeal. If you would like a quick way to boost your hearing for events like this, read on to find out how to improve hearing quality.

The basic method is this: wear earplugs for a couple of hours before whatever important event you need to boost your hearing for. This will mean planning a bit in advance, but a couple of hours is very quick when it comes to improving hearing. Used in combination with methods that improve hearing permanently over several weeks, you'll be able to have both the temporary boost when you need it and a permanent solution over time.

How does it work? A couple of ways. The first is by cutting your ears off from sound entirely, which makes them more sensitive to sound when you take the earplugs out again. Everything will sound amazingly clear compared to before using the earplugs.

The second way it works is by the effect it has on the muscles in the area. Hearing loss is often caused by poor blood flow to the area, which makes the muscles in the area weaker and less able to hold the best form for hearing. Earplugs open the area up for better hearing once they're removed. If your ears have felt blocked up for a while, this will, paradoxically, make them feel less blocked.

Be careful when using the earplugs. Always follow the instructions that come with whatever kind you buy. Make sure they're fitted properly, and don't stick them in too far. If the fit is correct, the earplugs shouldn't feel painful, and after a minute or so they won't even feel like they're there.

The specific type of earplugs doesn't matter beyond your own personal preference. If you find one material or shape easier to use than others, use that one. There isn't any major difference in overall quality between cheap earplugs and more expensive ones, so if you're on a budget just go for the least expensive kind available at the store.

This method will only give a temporary boost to your hearing, but the boost it gives will be very noticeable. Using this method to give short-term improvements to your hearing will make it easier to complete long term hearing loss treatments that improve hearing permanently, but gradually.

If you still haven't started any long term hearing loss treatment, Download our app to learn how to improve your hearing for good, starting today.

title: Hearing Education and Readiness
description: The purpose of the "Hearing Education and Readiness" course is to provide an overview on the importance of hearing loss prevention and protection requirements and information regarding hazardous noise exposure, diseases of the ear, and measures to take for preventing or mitigating hearing loss for DoD Civilians and Service Members enrolled in a Hearing Conservation Program (HCP) IAW  DoDI 6055.12 and Service specific instructions.  This course is provided by the DoD Hearing Center of Excellence.

title: Ultimate Ear/Headphone Test
description:
This is the ultimate application to test your earbuds and headphones! It contains a complete set of different tests for your earbuds to go through! Have you ever wondered whether you get worth for your money? The quality of your earbuds or headphones if of utmost importance when listening to music. A lot of people don't realise this, until they experience next-level sounds. It's all about the experience, the feeling.

Features:
★ High Frequency Test

★ Stereo Test

Although this app answered that question but not with full certainty. If there would've been a more nuanced test which could help detect any disparity in the sound levels of both sides, even better.

title: Tinnitus Sound Therapy Tinnitus Calmer White Noise
description:
Sound therapy, sometimes called acoustic therapy, can make the ringing or buzzing in your ears caused by tinnitus less noticeable. It won't cure the condition. But it can make it easier to live with. Enjoy

What is Tinnitus?
Tinnitus is the perception of noise or ringing in the ears. A common problem, tinnitus affects about 15 to 20 percent of people. Tinnitus isn't a condition itself — it's a symptom of an underlying condition, such as age-related hearing loss, ear injury or a circulatory system disorder.

😊Benefits of Sound Therapy for Tinnitus
Masking can help cover up some of the sound in your ears.
Distraction can take your attention off the sound.
Habituation is the idea that hearing the noise consistently can lead your brain to treat tinnitus as a less important sound that should be ignored.
Neuromodulation is based on the theory that tinnitus may be caused by too much activity in certain parts of your brain. So background noise could help change the patterns that cause the activity.

🎵 Sound Therapy for Tinnitus



Features of the app
- Listen with your screen blocked
- 🕑 Sleep timer: At the end of the timer, all sounds will end
- ⏰Alarm clock sounds peaceful
- Audio downloads
- Audio only mode
- Volume control
- Tinnitus Notch Therapy Offline: Click on the REC button, and download your favorite audios, you will find them in your Recordings.

Listen without needing a connection

title: Hear Glue Ear
description:
HearGlueEar is designed for children aged 2-6 who are experiencing hearing loss due to Glue Ear. It aims to reduce learning and development delays that can occur when children have hearing loss. The app helps to develop auditory processing and listening skills through specially designed songs, games and audiobooks that can be enjoyed through bone-conducting headphones. The app also provides valuable information, resources and progress-tracking for parents and carers.

https://hearglueear.wordpress.com/

The app also provides valuable information, resources and progress-tracking for parents and carers.

title: Tinnitus Treatment
description:
Envision a consistent ringing, humming or shrieking in your ear, 24 hours every day. It is called tinnitus. You never get a break. It is dependably there. 

No one else however you can hear the commotion since it doesn't originate from any outside source. 

In spite of the fact that you are the main individual who can hear the clamor it's anything but a consequence of your creative energy. 

You will learn:
How to Cure Tinnitus
Reduce Pulsating Tinnitus
How To Survive Tinnitus
How to Cope with Tinnitus
Stop Ringing in Ears
Causes of Tinnitus
How to Prevent Tinnitus
How to Stop Hearing Loss
Avoid Losing My Listening
Diet Help You Cure Tinnitus
How to Improve Your Hearing
Tinnitus Symptoms
Get Rid of Tinnitus Sound

Tinnitus can change a considerable measure between people; in this manner you can discover a wide range of sorts of tinnitus. 

Tinnitus differs extensively in power and sort. A few people depict tinnitus as high-recurrence shrieking sounds while others see tinnitus as a humming commotion or a sound like spread sizzling in a skillet. 

Be that as it may, some experience, rather, a pounding sound in indistinguishable cadence from their pulse. This is called pulsatile tinnitus. 

What causes tinnitus? The reasons for tinnitus may fluctuate. Be that as it may, the most widely recognized reason for tinnitus is introduction to commotion. However, tinnitus may likewise be cause by ailments, stress and head wounds 

No one knows what number of experiences tinnitus. All of us encounter tinnitus briefly; maybe for a couple of hours after a show or whatever other event where our ears are subjected to commotion. 

However, for some tinnitus winds up constant as well as increments. The greater part of individuals who experience the ill effects of tinnitus think that its exceptionally exasperating and awkward. 

Numerous who endure tinnitus encounter symptoms of their tinnitus. This may incorporate mental, physical and social issues. Some additionally encounter pressure, weariness, enthusiastic issues and discouragement. 

Many offer a fix or a treatment for tinnitus and some offer items against tinnitus, however so far there are no logical demonstrated treatment or solution for tinnitus. 

In any case, extraordinary composes adapting systems may assist individuals with living with their tinnitus. 

Tinnitus is normal in individuals beyond 40 years old, yet is winding up progressively pervasive in more youthful individuals, also, as a result of expanded day by day clamor levels, including those caused by the unreasonable utilization of MP3s, iPods and other individual stereos. 

Numerous individuals who experience the ill effects of tinnitus may likewise experience the ill effects of hearing misfortune. Despite the fact that tinnitus is more typical among individuals who experience the ill effects of hearing misfortune, anybody can experience the ill effects of tinnitus. It is likewise conceivable to experience the ill effects of real hearing misfortune without contracting tinnitus by any means. 

In the event that you encounter both tinnitus and hearing misfortune and you start to utilize listening devices, you will locate that portable hearing assistants may both enhance hearing and diminish the bothering of tinnitus. 

When you first experience tinnitus, you may normally be stressed and extremely mindful of this new stable. 

We continually screen our bodies and on the off chance that anything transforms, we wind up mindful of the progressions. 

Hearing tinnitus out of the blue can be very startling in the event that you think it implies that something isn't right with you, or that it may change your life. It's another sensation and you have to give yourself an opportunity to adjust. 

Download Tinnitus Application currently it's FREE!

title: SpeechCanvas
description:
SpeechCanvas（スピーチキャンバス）は、聴覚障害者と健聴者との会話を支援するアプリです。

話した言葉が次々と画面上で文字になり、画面を指でなぞれば絵や字がかけます。操作がシンプルでわかりやすいので、どなたでも簡単に使えます。
インターネットがつながらなくても音声認識してくれるので、電波の届かないところ、災害時など、いつでもどこでも安心です。
公共機関の窓口応対や店頭での接客サービス、職場や学校、ご家庭など、生活のさまざまなシーンでお使いいただけます。加齢による難聴といった、耳の聞こえにくい高齢者の方との会話も可能です。
情報通信研究機構(NICT)の研究成果である高精度な音声認識技術を活用しています。

■特徴
１．音声と筆談で会話がスムーズ
健聴者はことばを話し、聴覚障害者は筆談で応えることで、手話が使えなくてもより自然で円滑なコミュニケーションができます。公的機関の窓口や接客カウンター、学校などに常備しておけばやりとりがぐっとスムーズに。

２．指で簡単に修正が可能
音声認識された文字が間違っていても、指でなぞるだけのシンプルな操作で、すぐに修正できます。修正は、音声でもキーボード入力でもＯＫです。

３．電波の届かない場所でも使える
サーバに接続できない場合でも、タブレット内の組み込み型の音声認識を使用して、話した音声を文字に変換できるので、場所を問わず、どこでも使えるから安心です。

４．話した言葉が次々と文字に変わる
連続してしゃべった会話の内容が、流れるように次々と文字に変換されます。一つの文を話すごとに少し間をあけると、より正しい文字に変換されます。 

■制限事項など
インターネットに接続してご利用する場合、通信料はご利用者様負担となります。
通信状態によっては、結果表示に時間がかかることがあります。

description: Aplicativo no modelo questões com audiometrias a serem laudadas quanto ao tipo e grau de perda auditiva, com base, respectivamente, Silman e Silverman 1997 e Organização Mundial de Saúde - OMS 2014. O aplicativo fornece feedback para cada caso e se propõe a auxiliar o processo formativo de estudantes em audiologia, especificamente, avaliação audiológica no treino de habilidade de laudos em audiometria tonal.

title: Deaf Note - Typer for Deafies
description:
Are you a Deafie? Do you have problems communicating with hearing people who don't know sign language? Deaf Note helps you convey your message easily!

Features:
- Type out and display an upside-down message for the people in front of you
- Rotate your phone horizontally to display your message in full-screen landscape
- Invert your phone to allow people to reply you
- Customize the color, font, and size of your message

Meaning of Deafie: Slang for a Deaf person. This is acceptable, not derogatory, as used within the Deaf community.

About Deaf Culture & Community: https://sadeaf.org.sg/deaf-communityculture/

comments: This app is, literally, exactly what I needed. I just got my tonsils removed and it hurts so bad to talk to people, but I'm one of those people that always has something to say. Take that how you will. Haha It's basic, but perfect. I recommend it to "deafies". Not sure if the name is off-putting to people, but I think it's clever and love it. Worth the download just to have it. You'll need it at some point, I almost guarantee this.
Georgette. Costeniuc. Deaf.
Great !!
Not sure what to think about this app

title: Advanced Tinnitus Therapy For Seniors
description: Seniors are more likely to have both age related hearing loss and tinnitus, and although both can often be helped by a hearing aid some people need more help to reduce the tinnitus from their consciousness.  This app provides affected seniors - who have monotone tinnitus - with a totally free research based package of practical help and information including a personal Residual Inhibition (RI) tone tool that allows most users to turn off their tinnitus briefly - a useful aid, especially for sleeping.  A dual tone test also allows the user to match their tinnitus pitch frequency which is then applied to a modern technique called 'tailor-made music notching'.  Further tools include live web connections to assess tinnitus severity and also to test for age related hearing loss.  This app includes suggested day/night routines and equipment based on a variety of audio therapy types, relaxation exercises and Cognitive Behaviour Therapy (CBT) . The user is directed to free specific tinnitus and related CBT apps that support the daily routines by notching personal music in real time, provide relaxing guided imagery audio and offer a CBT Diary that encourages positivity.  Instructions are included for creating a portable personal Residual Inhibition tone MP3 track and portable tailored 'notched' music MP3 tracks using the free open source 'Audacity' software on a computer.  Buying cheaper discreet 'Completely In Canal' instant fit 8 channel, fully automatic, good quality hearing aids on the web is covered along with a related hearing aid volume control Android phone app.

title: Conversations - Sinhala
description:
•Listening, Thinking and Responding are essential for an effective communication. 
•Differences in Listening will affect Thinking and Responding.
•“Sanvaada” is an android application to translate pictures and signs into words and sentences and also to translate words and sentences into pictures.
•“Sanvaadha” can use to replace a sign language interpreter.  It could be used as a bridge between 400,000 deaf and hearing-impaired people in Sri Lanka and others through effective communication.
•An Android application which replaces a sign language interpreter.  A sign language interpreter appears on the mobile screen and responds to words and sentences keyed in.
•This will help reduce the communication gap prevailing among deaf and hearing impaired, numbering about 400,000 in Sri Lanka, and between the deaf and hearing impaired and the normal community.  It will also widen the communication scope of the deaf and hearing-impaired community, by allowing them to communicate with a large number including foreigners.

People are different. Different people use different communication methods to convey messages to get their work done. When communicating, we need to “Listen”, “Think” and “Respond” to make that communication effort be effective. People have different levels of “Listening”, “Thinking” and “Responding” capabilities. Some can’t “Listen” as others. Some can’t “Think” as others. Some can’t “Respond” as other due to their differences. If their capabilities of communication are equal, they may not encounter any difficulty during getting their work done. If people have a significant difference in “Listening”; subsequent “Thinking” and “Responding” processes will be affected. It may be so critical at times. Therefore, by bridging the gap of significant differences in “Listening”, which is the first barrier in the communication process, we can facilitate an “Effective Communication” between differently able communities. 

“Sanvaadha” mobile application, which represents the meaning of “Effective Communication” in the Sinhala language, is the solution. we developed as the “Pictorial Bridge between different listening capabilities of people”.  Sanvaada bridges the gap of understanding pictures and signs and translating those into words and sentences for the people need “Sound” to listen to their own language. “Sanvaadha” helps to translate words and sentences into pictures and signs for the people who are experts in “Listening through Signs”. Therefore, “Sanvaadha” can build bonds and harmony of “Differently Listening” people. “Sanvaadha” is accessible for all and freely available at the following link and could be installed easily by its installation guidelines. “Sanvaadha” is presently capable to serve people who communicate in Sinhala language and our team is working to release Tamil and English languages soon. “Sanvaadha" is looking forward to link through google translator or any best alternative to facilitate effective communication globally as well. With all above, Sanvaadha is bridging differences in listening capabilities of differently able people to think quickly and to respond promptly through effective communication.

This the biggest issue of the Sri Lankan Deaf community given as a solution to the communication barrier from Ahanna(listen) foundation. This project Sponsored by from Jinasena Training & Rehabilitation Trust, Software Programming and coding development by Xicigny (PVT) Ltd.

All rights reserved @Ahanna(listen) foundation.

title: HearAngel
description:
HearAngel® helps you to safeguard your hearing from permanent damage when using headphones with your phone.
Your hearing can be stressed and permanently damaged by large sound doses over time. As permanent loss of hearing may not become apparent until years later, careful listening today helps ensure clear listening in the future. HearAngel® monitors those aspects of your media audio that can lead to hearing loss, and helps you prevent it. 
It works by:
•	Monitoring your media content for contributions to hearing damage.
•	Showing you how your ears are being stressed or damaged in real time – the radar display.
•	Telling you how long you can listen to the current media at the present level before risk of damage.
•	Informing you of how much of your Daily Sound Allowance (DSA®) has been used so far today.
•	Giving you several options for automatic protection of your hearing.
•	Providing you with secure options for safeguarding your children.
•	Always monitoring, even in the background. 
•	Options for pop-up notification.
This release is for evaluation and testing purposes; it has some deliberate limitations in functionality as it’s calibrated for operation with Samsung phones and earbuds.

title: GENIUSlink
description:
The GENIUSlink App is compatible with Miracle-Ear GENIUS 2.0 and GENIUS Hearing Aids;  ME5400/5300, ME4400/4300, ME3400/3300, and ME2400 Products with wireless technology. This app will provide all the functions when used with a GENIUSlink and a bilateral fitting.

Device compatibility: the GENIUSlink App is compatible with any Android device running Android 2.3 or higher. We recommend using a Smartphone device rather than a tablet device for a preferred user interaction. 

Hearing aid compatibility:  The app is only compatible with the latest generation of Miracle-Ear Hearing Aids; ME5400/5300 (ME-1), ME4400/4300 (ME-2), ME3400/3300 (ME-3) and ME2400 (ME-4). 

The GENIUSlink App allows you to adjust the hearing aids with the following functions if configured by your hearing care professional:
- Volume 
- Listening situations
- External audio sources
- TrebleControl
- Tinnitus Volume
- Speech Navigator settings
- Connection status information
- Battery status information

The GENIUSlink is a discreet and simple-to-use audio streamer that wirelessly connects your GENIUS hearing aids with your environment. The Miracle-Ear GENIUSlink App allows you to control your GENIUSlink & hearing aids with all of your favorite audio sources directly from your mobile phone. Whether you are watching TV, listening to your favorite song or talking on your Bluetooth phone – control is in the palm of your hands.

Please thoroughly read the manual of your GENIUS hearing aids before using this app.

Change listening programs: With intuitive buttons, it is simple to change your listening programs. 

Volume Control: You can increase and decrease the volume of your hearing aids with a simple touch on the screen, as with the discretion of texting.

Mute: You can quickly mute your hearing aids with one touch of the app screen.

Battery Status: Check the battery status of your GENIUS 2.0 hearing instruments. 

Bass & Treble: Adjust the TrebleControl to fine tune the sound quality of your hearing aids.

Speech Navigator:  Adjust the span and direction of the microphones on GENIUS and GENIUS 2.0 technology only (ME5400/5300, ME4400/4300).  Speech Navigator is available in standalone mode and when in-use with GENIUSlink. 

Tinnitus Control:  Easily adjust the volume on your tinnitus program if set by your Hearing Care Specialist. 

Intended use: The GENIUScontrol App is intended to control Miracle-Ear hearing instruments by a patient within parameters set by the Hearing Care Specialist.

Discretion: The app acts as a remote control within your Android device and looks as though you are sending a text message from your phone.

User-friendly: simple to use and easily identify buttons.

Display: the screen of your Android device becomes the visual display of the GENIUSlink. You can easily adjust your hearing aids and check status information.

Note: If GENIUSlink is not present, basic features can be controlled with acoustic signals.

Control signals: This app generates short control signals which may be audible. To ensure correct operation for safety reasons:
1. While using the App do not hold the loudspeaker of this device to your ears or the ears of others
2. Do not use the device with headphones, headsets or other audio playback devices.

The Bluetooth word mark and logos are owned by the Bluetooth SIG, Inc., and any use of such marks by Miracle-Ear is under licenses. Other trademarks and trade names are those of their respective owners.

title: WHHIP - Hearing Health Primer
description:
An informational tool to help Warfighters take their hearing health into their own hands.  The app combines text with contextual demonstrations to provide knowledge and understanding of the dangers of auditory injury and what life could be like if proper precautions are not taken.  The Warfighter can experience hearing loss and tinnitus through simulations before a permanent and progressive disability is acquired.  When questions arise as to how well hearing protection devices (HPDs) are fitting, the HPD Check feature will allow the Warfighter to compare his/her current fit of HPDs in his/her own ears to examples of good fitting devices.

Support was provided by the Office of Naval Research (ONR) Noise Induced Hearing Loss (NIHL) Program - http://www.onr.navy.mil

When questions arise as to how well hearing protection devices (HPDs) are fitting, the HPD Check feature will allow the Warfighter to compare his/her current fit of HPDs in his/her own ears to examples of good fitting devices.

Support was provided by the Office of Naval Research (ONR) Noise Induced Hearing Loss (NIHL) Program - http://www.onr.navy.mil

title: Rehab Hearing & Speech Center
description:
Hearing Rehab is located Dhaka . We offer patients a complete line of hearing instruments from low priced starter aids to state of the art multi channel digital hearing instruments.

We are available to answer any questions you or your family members may have regarding your loss. There are no charges for the exams, follow up cleaning, or check ups.It is our mission to make professional hearing services as convenient as possible for our patients. Our services are available even for those on fixed or low incomes. If you are currently wearing aids, regardless of what brand they are, we will inspect and clean your hearing aids at no charge, arrange for repair service if necessary, and provide you with a package of fresh batteries for your aids at reasonable prices. Hearing Aids Delhi can provide many options to deal with your hearing loss, including our complete line of digital, programmable, and conventional hearing aids.

title: Ear Problems Guide
description:
"
   ★★★ Download It For Free ★★★

Learn How to Treat an Ear Problems!

Ear infections are caused by bacteria or viruses in the middle ear. Ear infections occur more often in children than adults. 
Some causes and contributing factors that lead to ear infections are wax buildup, upper respiratory infections, food allergies, environmental allergies, fetal alcohol syndrome, genetics, nutritional deficiencies and internal injuries.

Is that ear pain a plain old earache, an ear infection, or something else? Find out The Right Way to Treat an Ear Infection in this Application video series.

Turkish Sign Language; DEAF, CODA, ISL, işitme engelli, sağır, kısacası işaret dili öğrenmek isteyen herkes için...

title: First Ear
description:
Are you having difficulty hearing others?  Do you often need things repeated?  You may not even realize you have hearing loss because it occurs gradually.  Hearing loss is just not associated with the elderly, in fact, the majority of the people with hearing loss are younger than 65.

FirstEar Hearing is a screening tool created by FirstEar that allows you to test your hearing to determine if it is within normal range, or if you have a potential hearing loss.


Our advanced hearing screening offers:

• User friendly results that are displayed in an easy-to-understand format.

• The ability to send your results directly to your email so you can discuss further with a qualified hearing professional.

title: Voxi Kids - Easy speech
description:
Language development & vocabulary practice exercises designed in collaboration with speech pathologist to help children, parents and speech therapists. Voxi Kids contributes to the improvement of attention, development of speaking and listening skills, corrects articulation and fluency, improves visual and auditory memory, observation and general knowledge.
Our app includes several types of professional exercises used in speech therapy, such as categorizations, colors and positions in space. Voxi Kids can thus be used for educational purposes by both parents and children, at home and in speech pathology practices as working tool.
Designed to be like a mobile game, our app’s exercises offer new knowledge in a fun and enjoyable manner. We rely on a ‘learning through play’ approach throughout the game’s chapters.
Voxi Kids is primarily meant for
- children with speech impairments and issues of communication
- people struggling with hearing loss
- young children who may use it for language development
Ideal for preschoolers, but it can also be used by people of all ages.
Parents can access a graphical representation of their child’s progress in the app, including the time spent on each exercise or chapter so they can receive a full feedback on the usefulness of the app, as well as their child’s evolution.
Keep in mind, Voxi Kids is not meant to replace professional therapy, but to assist speech therapists in their activities and help children easily and conveniently exercise their language skills outside the practitioner’s office.
Take your personal speech therapy app along with you on your phone. Practice anytime and anywhere!

comments: I absolutely love this app! My kid is very interested in helping Nummo and completing all levels with max number of stars, and I'm happy that he mixes learning and playing activities :) i recommend this app!
App util pentru copiii cu deficiente de auz sau vorbire... grafica foarte clara, voce placuta, unui adult i se va parea simplu, dar e un produs conceput pentru copii care au nevoie de terapie.

O idee buna cu o implementare catastrofala. Copilul meu o utilizeaza pe telefon. Trebuie sa traga obiecte dintr-un loc in altul. In 50% din cazuri nu merge sa le dea drumul la destinatie pentru ca nu exista nici o indicatie ca se afla in locul potrivit. Iar locul potrivit nu este definit corect. Ma chinui si eu in foarte multe cazuri si nu merge, pur si simplu. Am dat 100 de lei sa ma enervez.

Interesantă. Să înțeleg că nu știe copilul să asculte de primește doar o stea... sau nici una în cadrul primului capitol? Înțeleg rostul reclamelor în cazul în care pui tot jocul gratis.... dar trebuie să le suportăm și la un demo! fyi: roșia e fruct....

title: Tinnitus Describer
description:
Q&A
----------
Q/What is Tinnitus Describer?
A/It is an application that helps People who have tinnitus to describe and measure what they hear in their heads.

Q/How can this application Describe my Tinnitus?
A/It will describe your tinnitus by identifying The type of tone and the volume of the tone.
                                
Q/How to use the application?
A/Here are few tips before using:
                1- You have to use mini earphones.
                2- Adjust the volume of the mobile to the 
                     highest degree. 
                3- You have to make the test in a calm room.

Q/What is next?
A/When You access to the main room to describe Your Tinnitus,A several buttons and sliders will appear.
The following steps are recommended:
        1 Adjust the volume with what suits your hearing.
        2 choose the tone closest to your tinnitus tone. 
        3- choose the appropriate pitch through the
             first slider.
         4- Select the appropriate volume for sound height
              through the second slder below.

          5- You can use multi layers now and save the tone.

         Q/Are other people will listen to what I hear exactly?
A/Yes and no,It will depend on hearing loss of both of 
     you. 

Q/Why did I feel that My tinnitus level has increased after using the 
application?
A/Yes,Some people will feel a high level of tinnitus after using the application because of the tension and focus on the subject of tinnitus as the best treatment for the tinnitus is ignoring it,We advice that people to 
leave the social media and applications who tuch with the tinnitus who may increase the level of tinnitus.

recentChanges:
Add multi layers
Add save and load
Remove the ID number
Reduce the size of the application
comments: I suffer with Tinnitus due to my tour of duty in Vietnam.it may sound strange but it's kind of pleasing to show people what tinnitus really sounds like. I would have rather been shot somewhere at least people could tell that I was injured but with tinnitus I'm hurting all the time and it seems like people don't even believe me when I tell them my ears are ringing. and recently I found out that I can use this app when my dog starts barking outside my home I turn up the tinnitus sound, he stops.
It is useful to be able to generate the sound for others to hear. but what's the point of having a save button if it doesn't work?
WARNING APP CONTINUES TO PLAY THE SOUND YOU SAVED EVEN AFTER YOU EXIT THE APP AND REMOVE THE HEADPHONES. THIS CAN BE DISTURBING TO THOSE AROUND YOU WHO HAVE GOOD HEARING.
Save button is non-functional, why are earth not!!
could not save button inoperative

title: Super Hearing Oreo 8.0 Free - Amplifier Eq PSAP
description:
7-day free trial for Hearing Aid for Oreo 8.0:

https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.stereomatch.hearing.aid

50% Oreo 8.0 devices crash app. Test this free app before purchase.  Update to Oreo 8.1.


Hearing Aid for Oreo uses audio capabilities of Android Oreo 8.0 to deliver lowest-latency, fastest-response Hearing Aid app on Google Play!

- Use headset or device microphones
- Listen on earphones or device earpiece/speakers

- Uses Oreo low latency audio for a practically usable Hearing Aid app!
- Runs in background, even with screen off!
- Tested: 10 hour continuous use on single battery charge (Nexus 4 - Oreo 8.1)

- Easy swiping between Volume, Equalizer and Settings screens
- Use Volume screen for overall volume setting
- Boost Hi-Band on Equalizer to compensate for age-related hearing loss
- Use Settings screen to choose which microphone and speaker to use.

- TalkBack friendly for blind users


DISCLAIMER:  Not a medical device.  Get hearing tested, and use devices prescribed by professionals.  Try this app to explore how apps can improve speech comprehension.

When you first use the app, be careful not to increase volume too high.  Volume can be adjusted using your Android volume buttons.  But if you don't want to change your Android volume levels, you should use the Volume screen to set overall volume depending on the environment you are in, and use the Equalizer screen to customize for each ear.


Age-related hearing loss

Age-related hearing loss usually affects the high frequency range of hearing.  Hearing aid devices can compensate for this by increasing the volume on the Hi-Band.  This can improve comprehension of fricative sounds like 't' and 'sh' ('show' and 'sow' or 'table' and 'cable' are often confused, if you have age-related hearing loss).

However, hearing loss may not always be at the high-frequency end, and may affect younger people as well.  Which is why testing is important, to figure out which frequency bands require boosting to compensate for the specific hearing loss in each ear.  The Hearing Aid device is then programmed to boost the frequency bands which require compensation.

This app provides a simple 3-band Equalizer.  Since it only has 3 volume settings to adjust, it may be easier for users to judge which settings work better for them.  Usually for age-related hearing loss, you will improve comprehension by boosting the Hi-Band on the Equalizer.  Other users may prefer other settings.


Earphones/headset, Lapel mic, or device microphone

Use earphones or headset for best results.  In a pinch, you can use the Android device's built-in earpiece to listen, while using the same device's built-in microphone - however, this approach will lead to feedback at higher volumes (the device microphone will hear the output of the device's earpiece or speaker, which is a feedback loop, which creates an unpleasant whine sound).  If you use an external lapel microphone, then you can use the built-in earphones on device to listen.

It is best to use earphones to listen, while using the device microphones to record.  Or use a lapel microphone, or USB microphone for better quality.  Whichever configuration you choose, test for latency - some combinations give lower latency (better) than others.  Usually this will give the lowest latency: using a headset (with built-in mic) or plugging a Y-splitter into the android earphone jack, and plugging in separate earphone and separate microphone into the Y-splitter.

Bluetooth headsets can be used, but usually have much higher latencies (bluetooth latency is high on android), so may be more confusing to use.


Low latency / Fast response (Oreo Audio)

This app makes use of the audio improvements in Android Oreo.

If you like the low latency quality of the app, please support by purchasing the app.

If you paid for the app, but are not satisfied, please click Menu - Contact to e-mail us for a refund.  Or e-mail us at: amazingaudiomp3recorder AT stereomatch.com

title: ASL Dictionary
description:
OVER 5,200 SIGNED WORDS

*App Guaranteed to work perfectly! Please email us if you have any problems at appsavers@gmail.com

(NOW ON SALE) LIMITED TIME OFFER

The most complete ASL American Sign Language Video Dictionary.

FEATURES
• 5,200 SIGNS
• 765 Multiple meaning words
• Multi-word signs like “don’t want"
• 473 Idioms translated
• Time
• Money 
• Dates 
• Months, Years
• General numbers
• Finger Spelled Alphabet
• Common Phrases like “You’re too late”
• Cache/save video to memory (optional)
• Slow motion feature
• Loop video

OVER 5,200 SIGNED WORDS

Translate English into ASL, from A-Z, plus the entire numerical system, common English phrases, symbols and much more. A must have educational App.

Learn Sign Language, by watching our professional Sign Language interpreter and instructor sign over 5,200 individual and multiple word signs. ASL is the first language for people who are deaf.

Note: 3G, or WiFi Internet is required.

Note: If you are a hearing person, there is no sound with this application.

Note: You must have available memory (space) on your SD card to download the videos.

CONTACT US: 
Comments, questions or support, please contact us at appsavers@gmail.com

THANK YOU

comments: This app is GREAT! Shows you signs of thousands of words. Play it normal, stick it on a loop, or even slow the signer down! Fantastic! One suggestion for future updates would be a "request word." I have come across a few words that aren't in this ASL dictionary, but seem like common enough words. Also, I know there are multiple signs for one word. Such as "dog" I know has 3 signs. Thank you for creating this app, I found it EXTREMELY HELPFUL!
Thank you, now I can learn sign language since I realized there are a lot more deaf people than I thought before. I think it's an essential language, and I am in love with the price of this app.

So the positive is you can view alot of different words, numbers and so forth but my only issues is that the phrases are just dubbed in from other videos making some gestures hard to see. And i would give it 4 stars if they actually took the time to make different videos for phrases. I would give it five stars if it had quizes and more learning aspects. Other then that i recommend this app for the purpose of it being a on the go learning tool. But def look into other options as well as this one because every other app ive tried is garbage.

I love the app. I do wish they'd update this is app or come out work a newer version. I world like the choice to either download and save all signs to SD Card or internal storage. Without WiFi I can't view new words. I have Data but it tells me to check my internet connection and it won't download new signs workout WiFi.
I paid for the app and then it kept telling me I need internet connection when I have unlimited data and wifi.. I feel ripped off

title: The gospel of Mark in Russian sign language
description:
The application is intended for deaf and hearing impaired people who speak the Russian Sign Language (RSL) and are interested in getting a deeper acquaintance with the Scriptures and studying it, as well as for hearing people, wanting to immerse themselves in the biblical text in sign language.
 
This online application includes video clips with the translation of the Gospel of Mark into the RSL, illustrated with graphical drawings of biblical realities and plots changing in the background, as well as maps of the places where the events described took place. The videos are supplemented with subtitles (that can be switched on), based on the reverse translation from the RSL, which has been drafted to help the perception of new concepts in translation, and enable you to compare the narrative story with the written text. Under the video is also the gospel text of two other translations to choose from (Synodal or modern), in which there are links to a dictionary with video explanations of key biblical concepts.

Two bugs in the text display of chapters 2 and 3 have been fixed.

The BSR contemporary text was replaced by a RSL adapted text, which is closer to the RSL translation on the video and will help the users to understand it better.

title: Music Volume Booster
description:
Audio player with amplified sound for the hearing-impaired.

The application is a music volume booster and works as an assistive hearing aid for listening to the audio files from:

-- Dropbox

-- Spotify

-- SoundCloude

-- Smartphone media library.

Music volume amplifier makes the music loud in those frequencies where there is hearing loss.

Music amplifier "Music Hearing App" restores natural hearing perception of the sound of music.

To adjust the assistive hearing aid audio player, you need to take a preliminary hearing test in the application.

One click to hear everything!

comments: This is a solid music player with the most options of any that I found, that's unique! I Googled and found nothing else that can do that on Android.
What a great app. I love how customizable everything is. Everything is just a few clicks away.
With its simple UI and sound effects, various of function makes the best music player app for me
A very user friendly app. It is very easy to use yet a very stylish musicplayer.
This player is the only decent music player to support deaf though and I appreciate the effort maintaining that functionality requires.

title: Komunicira.me
description:
Знаковен јазик е апликација која ќе ја сруши комуникациската бариера помеѓу лицата со оштетен слух и остатокот од светот. Без разлика дали потребата за комуникација се јавува во рамките на некоја институција, транспортно средство или неформално окружување, оваа апликација им овозможува на сите да го научат знаковниот јазик, и да комуницираат со лицата со оштетен слух.

Оваа апликација е изработена од учесниците на Академијата за програмирање на Brainster, како дел од нивната едукација преку работа на реален проект. Новитетот кој Brainster го воведува од оваа година, е учесниците од Академијата за програмирање да изработат 3 апликации кои ќе помагаат во решавањето на одреден социјален проблем. Освен што луѓето на овој начин ќе учат, и ќе може да ги вметнат проектите во нивното портфолио исто така ќе придонесат и за заедницата.

Оваа апликација е изработена од учесниците на Академијата за програмирање: Марко Доновски, Оливер Божиновски, Горан Воиновски и Панче Димовски, во соработка со наставничката Викторија Волак и учениците Мимоза Далили и Филип Лефков од Државниот училишен центар за образование и рехабилитација „Партенија Зографски” Скопје - училиште за средно стручно образование на ученици со оштетен слух. Основна дејност на центарот е: образование, воспитување, рехабилитација, професионално и работно оспособување на учениците. Креирањето на оваа апликација беше поддржано од Националниот сојуз на глуви и наглуви на Македонија, а дигиталната содржина е креирана од NewMediaMk.
‌
Brainster е иновативна компанија за едукација и кариерна трансформација која преку курсеви и Академии им овозможува на индивидуалците да дојдат до успешна кариера. Преку различните програми секој може да ги научи најбараните вештини за програмирање, маркетинг, дизајн и бизнис, па потоа да се поврзе со компании кои имаат потреба од најдобрите таленти.

www.komunicira.me

Znakoven jazik
descriptionHTML:
Знаковен јазик е апликација која ќе ја сруши комуникациската бариера помеѓу лицата со оштетен слух и остатокот од светот. Без разлика дали потребата за комуникација се јавува во рамките на некоја институција, транспортно средство или неформално окружување, оваа апликација им овозможува на сите да го научат знаковниот јазик, и да комуницираат со лицата со оштетен слух.

Оваа апликација е изработена од учесниците на Академијата за програмирање на Brainster, како дел од нивната едукација преку работа на реален проект. recentChanges: Оваа апликација е изработена од учесниците на Академијата за програмирање на Brainster.
comments: Ретко се наоѓаат апликации на пазарот кои што ќе бидат од социјално значење. Ми се допаѓа иницијативава и очекувам понатамошно развивање на продуктов. Со среќа дечки!

Браво за иницијативата и развивање на оваа апликација. Се надевам дека веќе имате во план за развој на следниве функционалности (пример):  1. Поле за внес на карактери за динамички (променлив) говор/интерпретација. 2. Говорен внес за интерпретација. 3. Тренинг (слично на Дуолинго) 4. Многу други кои би сакала да ги предложам.  Секоја чест, Дечки! Само напред.
Браво, дечки, секоја чест! Одлична идеја, одлично спроведено. Се надевам дека нема да запрете тука и дека ќе го проширувте фондот на зборови и фрази. Браво уште еднаш.
Како мала ја научив азбуката, сега сфатив дека некои букви погрешно сум ги научила 😊 Предобра иницијатива, само напред!
Браво за идејата,би сакала да има уште начини или нови изрази за да се учи постојано.

title: World Wide Hearing App (WWH App)
description:
World Wide Hearing Foundation International (World Wide Hearing or WWH), a non-profit
organization that provides access to affordable hearing aids and hearing care, has created a mobile data-collection application combined with a web portal for data aggregation to simplify carrying out the World Health Organization (WHO) hearing loss prevalence studies. The WWH App is Android-based, free of charge and can be used both online and offline to capture patient data using the WHO hearing loss data collection form. 

By replacing the traditional paper-based data collection system with a mobile, Android-based application, prevalence studies can be conducted more time- and cost-effectively by reducing the need for manual data entry and transcription. Furthermore, the web-based administrator portal enables researchers and/or project leads to track progress and data collection in real time.

APPLICATION

The WWH app uses the latest version of the WHO data collection form for hearing loss
prevalence studies. This data collection form includes the following sections:

- Consent form
- Patient history questionnaire
- Hearing examination
- Tympanometry
- Ear examination
- Causes of hearing loss/recommended action questionnaires.

All of these sections can be filled out on a single Android device or by different team members on multiple devices. If the devices have an active internet connection during the field tests, the app will sync data between the different Android units, giving the different team members access to the previously recorded data from other devices. If internet is not available during field tests, tested persons will be given the same Patient ID on different devices so that the datasets can be matched in the backend.

The hearing examination section gives three different options for data entry:
1. Otoacoustic Emission (OAE) test for children up to five years of age
2. For people aged five years and older:
       - Manual data entry of hearing thresholds from any audiometer.
3. For people aged five years and older:
       - Automatic data entry thanks to a third-party, Android-based hearing threshold
application, such as HearTest. Currently, the WWH app can automatically integrate data collected with HearTest.
       - HearTest is a threshold-seeking hearing loss app created by HearX, a South
African software company. When using the hearing threshold app option, the
HearTest external app is launched and a hearing test can be performed. The
results from this hearing test app are automatically imported into the GHLD app. Any other test similar to HearTest could be used.

After syncing the mobile devices with the internet, the data-collection progress can be
instantaneously observed through the connected web portal. For easy and prompt data
analysis, the collected raw data can be downloaded daily from the data server. The
administrator web portal allows not only to track the progress of the study, but also to set up the study’s test clusters. The administrator portal can be accessed at:
https://globalhearingloss.org.

For information and user accounts, please contact: ghld-support@wwhearing.org.

title: Deaf Communication (Pro)
description:
Gone are the days when you needed to write down everything on a piece of paper or learn sign languages to communicate with deaf and hearing impaired people.This speech to text app was made specifically as a conversation platform and not as a speech dictation platform to communicate efficiently and as quickly as possible with people who don't know sign language.Whenever you want to hear something from someone,just tell them to speak to the phone,the app then automatically generates the voice into text so that you can read what they are trying say.Also,the app deletes the previous text automatically when they say something new(So that it doesn't seem like you are reading a book with a bunch of text).if you want talk back then write on the app whatever you want to say and press the speaker button(on the right side of the mic button) and it will generate the text to speech.


Features:
-No ads as this is the pro version
=Two way communication(speech to text and text to speech).
-it supports over 140 different languages
-Users are given the freedom of selecting a text size of their own choice
-There is an offline mode to access the voice to text app offline by downloading and installing languages(only available in this pro version)
-Users can copy the text to clipboard
-A simple and beautiful user interface.

title: Speech Therapy
description:
Speech Therapy is Basically a treatment that people of all ages can undergo through, to fix their speech. Although speech therapy alone would focus on fixing speech related problems like treating one’s vocal pitch, volume, tone, rhythm and articulation.

Speech Therapy App provides all this Topic Full Information
Speech Therapy Introduction
Importance of Play in Speech Therapy
Delineating Speech And Language Therapy
Conditions for Speech Therapy
Conditions for Speech Therapy: Autism
Therapy Procedures for Speech Disorders
Speech Therapy for the Hearing Impaired
Speech Therapy for Intermediate Stuttering
Speech Therapy Management for Fluency Disorders
Toys As Materials For Speech Therapy
Speech Therapy Book
Etc..
Speech Therapy in Detail, Speech Therapy Guide in Detail, Speech Therapy Techniques in Detail

title: Calculadora de Audiologia
description:
Aplicativo para classificação do grau da perda auditiva.

Contém todas as classificações incluídas no Guia de Orientação na Avaliação Audiológica do conselho de fonoaudiologia.

Lloyd e Kaplan, 1978
Davis, 1970-1978
BIAP, 1996
Organização Mundial da Saúde 2014, 2019 

Comece escolhendo a classificação desejada.          
Digite os valores da audiometria das frequências pedidas, Caso prefira falar é só clicar no microfone embaixo da caixa de texto e falar o valor.  
Clique em resultado.

O aplicativo ira mostrar: 

Média das frequências
Grau da perda auditiva
Desempenho esperado do paciente

Obs: Sempre que alterar algum valor ou a classificação clique em resultado novamente  para ter as informações corretamente.

title: TINNITUS TREATMENTS - Pulsatile Tinnitus
description:
Though many may suffer with the symptoms, there are also many who do not know the medical term or wonder just what is tinnitus? In simple terms, this refers to the noise that can be heard inside the ear or head of the affected person. The sound is described as ringing, wheezing, buzzing, and other mostly high-pitched, shrill and repetitive notes. For some, the noise is heard periodically; for others, it is heard constantly without pause or cessation.

While there is no actual loss of hearing in tinnitus, the repetitive and constant sounds distracts the person from clearly perceiving or interpreting the sounds from his/her surroundings. For people with worst cases, tinnitus provides them virtually no quiet moment during all waking hours, and even cause them difficulty in getting a decent good night's sleep.

Tinnitus can greatly affect the quality of life of the person suffering from it. Normal activities, even something as simple as walking on the street, can be severely limited and risky due to the difficulty in focusing and cognitive ability brought about by the distracting noises. On a day-to-day basis, tinnitus causes headaches, dizziness, lack of sleep, and plain hopelessness at having to endure such conditions that are seemingly without cure.

Likewise, the social, professional and personal relationships of a person with tinnitus is also limited, since interacting with other people requires clearly understanding and correctly interpreting nuances in verbal and interpersonal communications. Career choices can be extremely narrowed down, as important professional skills, such as ability to focus and to follow instructions, can be hindered by the auditory distractions caused by tinnitus. Working in the fields of construction and infrastructure, machinery operations, and occupations with hazardous environments are also often crossed out from workplace possibilities.

Holistic methods of approaching tinnitus is said to help people manage daily activities, boost their health, and improve their quality of life. Meditation, acupuncture, yoga, biofeedback training and hypnosis can greatly induce relaxation, thereby relieving the stress and tensions brought about by tinnitus, and eventually make the noises subside. The wellness duo of eating well and regular exercise is also highly recommended, not just to ease tinnitus but to potentially fight the medical conditions that cause it. With a clear understanding of exactly what is tinnitus as well as its causes and effects, you can make informed choices when looking for ways to treat tinnitus.

By Downloading and using this FREE TINNITUS TREATMENTS App you will learn;

What is Tinnitus? 
Tinnitus Pain - How to Stop It!
Pulsatile Tinnitus Treatment and Natural Tinnitus Cures
Tinnitus and Depression - Heal Your Tinnitus and Your Depression-Related Tinnitus Too!

AND
Much much more..........


Disclaimer:
The info contained in the app is not a substitute for professional medical or health advice, examination, diagnosis, or treatment. This app disclaims any liability for any decisions you make based on the information provided.


*** Please Do Rate the APP and leave a reply on your valuable suggestions and improvements ***

title: Señas Honduras
description:
La Lengua de Señas de Honduras (LESHO) es un sistema creado para la comunicación entre las personas sordas y oyentes, el cual no solo requiere la utilización de las manos, sino también características como ser: expresiones faciales, gestuales, lenguaje corporal, espacio visual, estructuras gramaticales.
En su primera versión cuenta con doce categorías, iniciando por una recopilacion de las señas más comunes para comenzar con la Lengua de Señas de Honduras (LESHO). 
Se apunta crear una solución general para la población de Honduras para el aprendizaje tanto de personas con discapacidad auditiva como para oyentes.
Desarrollado con la ayuda de la Asociación de Sordos de Honduras (ASH) y la Escuela "Manos Felices".
Se continuara añadiendo señas para hacer esto una aplicación más completa.

recentChanges: Agregada nueva sección "Lugares".
comments: Pretty sweet! User-friendly with a simple and extremely practical layout. Perfect for anyone who's trying to learn Honduran Sign Language in order to help the deaf.
¡Por favor agreguen más palabras! Tiene muy buena calidad, aunque solo con ellas palabras no es suficiente para comunicarse bien. Por favor agreguen más para aprender durante esta cuarentena:)
Me alegra tanto que exista esta aplicación. Sin duda aumentar el nivel del contenido sería muy positivo. Esto es un pequeño aporte para la complejidad del lenguaje
Excelente, me encantaría poder aprender mucho más ...porfavor continúen actualizando esta app.
excelente aplicación

title: Let ME Hear Again PRO for Deaf
description:
This app is created as a part of the LET ME HEAR AGAIN project for the deaf.
This project is not crowdfunded nor supported by any grants, but rather by the personal savings of a handful of people who believe in Good Karma.

★★★ It has received the prestigious App Inventor-App of the Month award from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) in the United States ★★★
read more about it from here.
http://goo.gl/btS9OK

Let ME Hear Again PRO consists of 4 Powerful tools for the Deaf, integrated into one.

★ FACE TO FACE CHAT
It is basically the Speech Recognition on Steroids! 
It recognizes conversations in 71 languages and displays the words on the screen in the native language itself.
Live Translation to 41 languages
It has a Talk-Back feature, where the person can type in his reply and the phone will speak it out aloud
Features a Full-screen Speech to Text Chat with Re-sizable Fonts
Auto Speech Recognition mode with custom timer

★ VIRTUAL NOTES
This tool has the ability to capture speeches and long conversations and save it as words in Phone memory, after speech recognition
It is designed to help Deaf Students and Professionals, and can be used to save Class Lectures, to-do lists, Key points from Group discussions & Meetings and so on
These saved  notes can be edited later if needed, and can even be translated to any language of choice
Notes can be shared directly to their friends through social media

★QUAKE AWAKE ALARM FOR DEAF
This alarm when fired will produce a sound above 100dB (most deaf persons have hearing loss to sounds below 90dB) and vibrates the phone for 2 minutes
The combination of Loud sound and Vibration will help the deaf to wake up

★GUARDIAN ANGEL
The last tool is intended to save a deaf person from dangerous situations, by alerting him at the right moment.
It is a personal watchdog for the deaf person and in this case, it’s a cat called Angel.
It is created following a real incident in the US where a pit bull dog saved a deaf boy from a house fire.
This cat can be turned on by setting the timer and the person can continue doing his normal works
It will automatically search for loud sounds in the surroundings at the set intervals
Once it catches something, it will start crying (meow) at very high intensity and vibrates the phone until the person picks it up

__________________________________________________________________________________

WHAT MAKES THIS APP UNIQUE

❤Dedicated customer support. Contact us at letmehearagain@gmail.com for any technical issues
❤ Beautiful and Easy to Use Interface
❤ Universal Device Support-Icons and Images auto re-size to fit the screen resolution
❤ Completely Ad Free
❤ Do NOT access any Personal Information
❤ Detailed Tutorial Videos and Graphical Help sections

FACEBOOK PAGE

https://www.facebook.com/let.me.hear.again
descriptionHTML:
This app is created as a part of the LET ME HEAR AGAIN project for the deaf.
This project is not crowdfunded nor supported by any grants, but rather by the personal savings of a handful of people who believe in Good Karma.

★★★ It has received the prestigious App Inventor-App of the Month award from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) in the United States ★★★
read more about it from here.
http://goo.gl/btS9OK

Let ME Hear Again PRO consists of 4 Powerful tools for the Deaf, integrated into one.

★ FACE TO FACE CHAT
It is basically the Speech Recognition on Steroids!
It recognizes conversations in 71 languages and displays the words on the screen in the native language itself.
Live Translation to 41 languages
It has a Talk-Back feature, where the person can type in his reply and the phone will speak it out aloud
Features a Full-screen Speech to Text Chat with Re-sizable Fonts
Auto Speech Recognition mode with custom timer

★ VIRTUAL NOTES
This tool has the ability to capture speeches and long conversations and save it as words in Phone memory, after speech recognition
It is designed to help Deaf Students and Professionals, and can be used to save Class Lectures, to-do lists, Key points from Group discussions & Meetings and so on
These saved notes can be edited later if needed, and can even be translated to any language of choice
Notes can be shared directly to their friends through social media

★QUAKE AWAKE ALARM FOR DEAF
This alarm when fired will produce a sound above 100dB (most deaf persons have hearing loss to sounds below 90dB) and vibrates the phone for 2 minutes
The combination of Loud sound and Vibration will help the deaf to wake up

★GUARDIAN ANGEL
The last tool is intended to save a deaf person from dangerous situations, by alerting him at the right moment.
It is a personal watchdog for the deaf person and in this case, it’s a cat called Angel.
It is created following a real incident in the US where a pit bull dog saved a deaf boy from a house fire.
This cat can be turned on by setting the timer and the person can continue doing his normal works
It will automatically search for loud sounds in the surroundings at the set intervals
Once it catches something, it will start crying (meow) at very high intensity and vibrates the phone until the person picks it up

title: Auditory Test
description:
This is an app to test the quality of hearing a person has. This can also be used to check the ear pod, headphone and speaker pair's stereophonic sound quality.
Later test is most obvious and can be done in no specific order.  The following is the ideal procedure for testing the hearing quality of person  You will need a well-fitting pair of ear buds or headphones to perform this test.
The play sound buttons are at the top of the screen after every play stop the respective sound. 1. Jack in the head phones and put them on the test subject.                                                     2. Ensure that the designated side of the headphones aligns to the correct ear i.e. right ear pods to the right ear and left ear pods to the left ear. 3. Adjust the volume of the phone to ~20%. 4. Keep the app screen hidden from the test subject Play the sounds right, both and left sequentially Then play the sounds randomly so that each sound is played at least five times. 5. While playing the sounds keep questioning the subject about the direction of the sound If you get the correct answers 100% times there is no problem with the hearing If no sound in either of the ears check your headphones. 6. If the test subject is not able to answer the "right" or "left" sound then possible loss of hearing in the respective ear In case when playing "both" sound the test subject can hear the sound in only one ear then the other ear has a detoriated sound quality
This test doesn't give a conclusive result about hearing loss. This application is not to draw any conclusions or any prognosis. If the results derived from this app needs to be followed up with a medical practitioner. In case of any kind of discomfort discontinue the test and consult a qualified otolaryngologist.

title: Tunefork Personal Sound
description:
TuneFork is audio personalization software that delivers the optimal hearing experience, improving quality of life for people with hearing loss and elders.
Hearing is an individual experience. Each of us has unique hearing earprints. This is why no one sound system is perfect for everyone. When you listen to unbalanced audio, you will always miss something. In some cases, you may even cause damage to your hearing. 
The TuneFork app allows you to take a hearing test when and where is most convenient to you. You could take the test in your living room, without going anywhere, and discover your unique earprint. The test is simple yet accurate, following the same protocols as a clinical hearing test that would usually only be done in special booths in hearing centers.
After taking the test, the result - your earprint - is converted by a sophisticated algorithm into an audio filter adjusted to meet your hearing needs.

About the test:
- Should take 6-7 minutes
- Tests both ears to fully determine your earprint
- Clinically tested in laboratory conditions and regular home environments

The technology behind the app was developed by the TuneFork team with the support of Gal Hearing Systems. We guarantee that this is the most accurate self-test out there.
We are working hard to improve the test and the adjustment algorithm to bring new optimal and exciting hearing experience to everyone everywhere.

Please share your feedback with us: customerservice@tunefork.co.il

title: Hear & Watch: Connected in Communication NSDSK
description:
Hear & Watch is an app for parents (and relatives) of a deaf or hard of hearing child from the age of 0 to 1 1/2 years. This app offers information on various topics related to hearing loss in young children (e.g. hearing aids, language development, parent-child interaction). The app contains brief articles with pictures and video's. The articles in the app can be translated automatically into 12 languages.

Hear & Watch is developed by the NSDSK and is based on the method 'Connected in Communication'.

title: TİD Sözlük
description:
Türk İşaret Dili Sözlüğü, işitme engelli bireyler ve İşaret Dili bilmeyenler arasındaki iletişimi sağlayan; işitme engelli bireylerin kişisel gelişimlerine destek olan bir mobil uygulamadır.

Yenilenen “Türk İşaret Dili Multimedya Sözlüğü” işaret dilinin resimlerden öğrenilmesinin zor olduğu düşünülerek işaret dili, video çekimleri ile daha kolay anlaşılır hale getirildi. Ayrıca dudak okuyanlar düşünülerek kelimelerin dudak hareketlerinin yakın plan çekimleri yapıldı. İşaretler alt yazı ile ve görsel resimlerle desteklendi.

İşaret dilinin yaygınlaştırılması için tasarlanan sözlük, işaret dilini bilenlerin sayısını arttırdıkça, TİD hakkında bir farkındalık yarattıkça, işitme engelli bireylerin çevresinde işaret dili kullananların sayısı arttığında hayatlarındaki engellerden en büyüğünün kaldırılmasına destek verilmiş olacaktır. Ayrıca işaret dilini kullanan birey sayısının artması işitme engelli bireylerin toplumsal entegrasyonunu kolaylaştıracaktır.

title: RAS: Remote Audiology System
description:
World Wide Hearing Foundation International (World Wide Hearing or WWH), a non-profit
organization that provides access to affordable hearing aids and hearing care, has created a mobile data-collection application combined with a web portal for data aggregation to simplify carrying out the World Health Organization (WHO) hearing loss prevalence studies. The WWH App is Android-based, free of charge and can be used both online and offline to capture patient data using the WHO hearing loss data collection form. 

By replacing the traditional paper-based data collection system with a mobile, Android-based application, prevalence studies can be conducted more time- and cost-effectively by reducing the need for manual data entry and transcription. Furthermore, the web-based administrator portal enables researchers and/or project leads to track progress and data collection in real time.

APPLICATION

The WWH app uses the latest version of the WHO data collection form for hearing loss
prevalence studies. This data collection form includes the following sections:

- Consent form
- Patient history questionnaire
- Hearing examination
- Tympanometry
- Ear examination
- Causes of hearing loss/recommended action questionnaires.

All of these sections can be filled out on a single Android device or by different team members on multiple devices. If the devices have an active internet connection during the field tests, the app will sync data between the different Android units, giving the different team members access to the previously recorded data from other devices. If internet is not available during field tests, tested persons will be given the same Patient ID on different devices so that the datasets can be matched in the backend.

World Wide Hearing Foundation International (World Wide Hearing or WWH), a non-profit
organization that provides access to affordable hearing aids and hearing care, has created a mobile data-collection application combined with a web portal for data aggregation to simplify carrying out the World Health Organization (WHO) hearing loss prevalence studies. The WWH App is Android-based, free of charge and can be used both online and offline to capture patient data using the WHO hearing loss data collection form.

By replacing the traditional paper-based data collection system with a mobile, Android-based application, prevalence studies can be conducted more time- and cost-effectively by reducing the need for manual data entry and transcription. Furthermore, the web-based administrator portal enables researchers and/or project leads to track progress and data collection in real time.

APPLICATION

The WWH app uses the latest version of the WHO data collection form for hearing loss
prevalence studies. This data collection form includes the following sections:

- Consent form
- Patient history questionnaire
- Hearing examination
- Tympanometry
- Ear examination
- Causes of hearing loss/recommended action questionnaires.

All of these sections can be filled out on a single Android device or by different team members on multiple devices. If the devices have an active internet connection during the field tests, the app will sync data between the different Android units, giving the different team members access to the previously recorded data from other devices. If internet is not available during field tests, tested persons will be given the same Patient ID on different devices so that the datasets can be matched in the backend.
summary: This app helps to run hearing loss prevalence studies more efficiently.

title: 신생아 청력선별검사
description:
출생 시부터 3세까지는 언어의 발달과 정서발달에 가장 중요한 시기로 이 시기에 청력손실은 좋지 않은 결과를 초래한다. 신생아기에 발견이 어렵기 때문에 조기발견의 중요성과 신생아 청각선별검사 절차, 결과해석 및 검사종류,  신생아의청력, 언어발달, 그리고 대전지역 병원 등에 대한 정보를 제공한다.

본 앱은 우송대학교 졸업과제프로젝트(캡스톤디자인) 수업에서 김아름 이슬기 김자연 김혜린 천예리가 작성한 안내지침서 내용을 가지고 제작하였습니다.

title: VHS Hearing Solutions
description: This on-line hearing test offers you an easy, fast way to determine whether you suffer from hearing loss. At the conclusion of the test you will have a printable audiogram that can be used to determine what hearing device can work best for you. Bookmark this page and run this hearing test periodically to monitor your hearing. Please note some of the audio tests tones can be excessively loud if used improperly. To avoid problems, follow the sound level calibration procedure and always begin by playing the quieter files first. Below are the three sections that will take you through the hearing test.

title: Znakujte s Tamtamem
description:
Mobilní aplikace Znakujte s Tamtamem má podpořit komunikaci mezi rodiči a jejich malými dětmi (nejen) se sluchovým postižením.

Co v aplikaci naleznete?
1. Slovník s téměř 1500 slovíček a vět a snadným vyhledáváním
2. Výuka členěná do tématických lekcí s různými stupni obtížnosti
3. Kvízy s vyhodnocením pro testování vašich znalostí

Aplikace v sobě obsahuje všechna videa, takže při jejím používání nemusíte být připojeni k internetu. Můžete se tak bez omezení učit znakový jazyk kdykoli na to budete mít čas a chuť. 

Pozn.: Používáte-li aplikaci na Androidu 4.4.1, budete mít pravděpodobně problém s přehráváním videí. Jedná se o známou chybu v této verzi Android OS a vyřešíte ji updatem na verzi 4.4.2 a vyšší.

Pro koho je aplikace určená?
- Primárně pro slyšící rodiče a příbuzné neslyšících a nedoslýchavých dětí ve věku 0 - 4 roky
- Odborníkům a studentům v profesích, které předpokládají kontakt s dětmi se sluchovým postižením
- Příbuzným a přátelům neslyšících a nedoslýchavých lidí, kteří se dorozumívají českým znakovým jazykem
- Slyšícím rodičům slyšících dětí, kteří se rozhodli komunikovat se svými dětmi skrze znaky ještě před vývojem mluvené řeči
- Široké veřejnosti se zájmem o český znakový jazyk a svět sluchového postižení

O vydavateli
Centrum pro dětský sluch Tamtam, o.p.s. je nezisková organizace s celorepublikovou působností poskytující komplex profesionálních sociálních, poradenských, vzdělávacích a informačních služeb především pro rodiny s dětmi se sluchovým postižením, ale také pro dospělé osoby se sluchovým postižením. V rámci své činnosti se věnuje také tvorbě materiálů, které informují o problematice sluchového postižení a materiálů, které mohou rodiče využít při výchově svých dětí.

Více informací naleznete na http://znakovka.frpsp.cz/

Perfektni

title: For deaf -sound visualizer-
description:
This app visualize sound(volume and tone).
For person having difficulty in hearing(Deaf person).

Volume and Tone are represented by circle, color and vibration.
Deaf parson can feel sounds.
You can set specific  volume level and tone level.  If  sounds over this level,  Mobile vibrate and center circle color change.

This app have also voice recognition function. 
Talking is converted to words by this function. 
It's helpful to talking!

Example
 • To notice noise. 
 • To notice baby crying.
 • To notice beep, alarm.
and so on.

※This app is reference level for deaf person.
※I shall not be responsible for any loss, damages and troubles.

title: H & T Sound Therapy
description:
Easy to use broadband noise player, which can be helpful to treat hyperacusis and/or tinnitus successfully if administered properly. It is also recommended for relaxing, improving concentration or as a help to go to sleep.


THREE COLORS OF NOISE
You can choose among pink noise, white noise or brown noise. All of them are high quality sounds with a bandwitdh of 1-22,050 Hz.

FINE VOLUME CONTROL 
Even the lowest volume of some devices can sound too loud for some hyperacusis sufferers. This app has a fine volume control that will let you adjust the volume to your needs, whatever they are. 

It also lets you adjust the volume with high precision so that the volume gap between one step and the next one is not a problem anymore.

BALANCE CONTROL
You can adjust the balance between the left and the the right channel. This may be helpful when there is some degree of hearing loss in one or both ears.

EQUALIZER
Some frequencies may be specially difficult to tolerate. This feature lets you adjust the gain of different frequency bands in order to meet your needs. It can also be used to modify the tone color of the noise and get a more pleasant sound for you.

AUDIO FADE IN
You can enable this feature to avoid sudden start playing, which may be annoying at a certain volume.

COUNT UP/DOWN TIMER
This app has a two-mode timer that will help you to control time of exposure.

ADS-FREE
This app is free and has no ads.

title: Olelo Captioned Calls
description:
Olelo Captioned Calls is an FCC-certified service lets you make and receive phone calls with instant live captions.  It's free for qualified users with hearing loss!

*** This app is for deaf and hard-of-hearing users only!  Your registration information is used only for purposes of preventing fraudulent use of Olelo *** 

It's super easy to get started with Olelo:

After you install the app, just go through the simple signup form to create an account.     You can now start making captioned phone calls!

You'll receive a new Olelo phone number for incoming calls, or you can optionally have all calls to your usual mobile phone number forwarded to Olelo for captioning.  You'll also have quick access to your saved contacts, and can dial and receive calls from any phone number, just like your regular phone.  

Olelo provides instant live captions of your entire conversation (both sides!), and all captions are generated by state-of-the-art AI speech recognition for maximum speed, accuracy, and privacy. 

Olelo works anywhere you have good WiFi or mobile data service.
 
After signup, please click "Allow" or "OK" when asked to grant permissions to the Olelo app.

FEDERAL LAW PROHIBITS ANYONE BUT REGISTERED USERS WITH HEARING LOSS FROM USING INTERNET PROTOCOL (IP) CAPTIONED TELEPHONES WITH THE CAPTIONS TURNED ON.

Please report any bugs and feedback to olelo-android@machinegenius.net

Happy calling!

Thanks,
The Olelo Team
