By all means, please update it to the latest version and use it in the best condition.
comments: I've tried many OCR apps (image to text converter) and none of them came close to what this app produces. Although it is still not perfect yet (which is mainly because of infinite handwriting styles), at least it doesn't produce gibberish like the other apps. I hope the algorithm keeps improving and it would be great if you could add speech for other language texts too.

Have been looking for an app to transcribe my handwritten notes to editable text for a while. Just downloaded this app after reading a positive review. The said OCR is by no means perfect, but then neither is my handwriting and so far I am actually pretty impressed. I like to save an image of the page to OneNote and then copy the transcribed text next to it. Would be great if I could setup a macro to do both in one go.

On my galaxy s9 I am using this app in tandem with quizlet (split screen view) to create a study guide. I'm surprised I couldn't find this option on google keyboard, but this is a fine alternative. Ads are annoying but never that bad, and the very empirical way the text is transcribed is much appreciated. 5 stars for functionality, overall 4.7 because ads

Top of the line, excellent for small receipts and business cards. Good for books but you might need two or three takes per page. I couldn't test it properly for handwriting during the very limited trial time allowed. Overall the development of this APP is marvelous, excellent work!

This app has been a very useful tool. I'm so grateful for the intelligence put into making it. God bless you guys. Edit. Now you can't use this app without subscription. It gives you a trial period, after which, you have to subscribe to use it. It's been good while it lasted. Goodbye, I'm uninstalling now.

title: BabyBeats™ Early Intervention Resource (NL)
description:
Er gaan allerlei vragen en gedachten door je hoofd zodra je de diagnose ‘uw kind heeft een gehoorverlies’ krijgt. In deze emotionele tijd, bezaait met twijfels, vragen ouders ook heel vaak: ‘Wat kan ik nu voor mijn kind doen?’

Uit onderzoek is gebleken dat die eerste vroege ervaringen die je samen met je kind beleeft, heel belangrijk zijn voor hun ontwikkeling. Die eerste 5 jaar noemen ze zelfs ‘een kritische periode’ voor hersenontwikkeling; waarbij er in die eerste paar maanden van hun leven een aantal heel belangrijke zenuwbanen worden gevormd.

Het is dus van belang om je baby’s hersenen goed te stimuleren tijdens dit cruciale moment; omdat hun hersenen zullen verdubbelen in omvang tijdens het eerste levensjaar!

En we weten dat muziek de enige activiteit is die verschillende delen van de hersenen tegelijk stimuleert. Al deze gebieden zijn belangrijk voor het ontwikkelen van spraak en taal. 

De band die je opbouwt met je kind heeft ook een effect op andere gebieden van hun ontwikkeling. Dus het is niet verrassend dat er veel onderzoek is gedaan naar de voordelen van muziek voor bonding, emotionele ontwikkeling en vroege communicatie.
 
BabyBeats™  is zo ontwikkelt dat het alle zintuigen van je baby stimuleert tijdens leuke  muzikale activiteiten. Op deze manier help je jouw kind bij het ontwikkelen van hun hersenen en vroege communicatie.

Dit samen vormt het fundament voor alle communicatie die jouw kind zal ontwikkelen gedurende zijn/haar peuter- en kleuterjaren.
  
De app bestaat uit 2 delen: ‘Baby’s’ en ‘Peuters’. Ga naar de ‘Baby’ sectie als uw baby nog heel jong is en hoorapparaten draagt, of als ze wachten op hun cochleaire implantaten.
Ga naar de ‘Peuter’ sectie als uw kind zijn/haar hoortoestellen of CI’s al langere tijd draagt.
descriptionHTML:
Er gaan allerlei vragen en gedachten door je hoofd zodra je de diagnose ‘uw kind heeft een gehoorverlies’ krijgt. In deze emotionele tijd, bezaait met twijfels, vragen ouders ook heel vaak: ‘Wat kan ik nu voor mijn kind doen?’

Uit onderzoek is gebleken dat die eerste vroege ervaringen die je samen met je kind beleeft, heel belangrijk zijn voor hun ontwikkeling. Die eerste 5 jaar noemen ze zelfs ‘een kritische periode’ voor hersenontwikkeling; waarbij er in die eerste paar maanden van hun leven een aantal heel belangrijke zenuwbanen worden gevormd.

Het is dus van belang om je baby’s hersenen goed te stimuleren tijdens dit cruciale moment; omdat hun hersenen zullen verdubbelen in omvang tijdens het eerste levensjaar!

En we weten dat muziek de enige activiteit is die verschillende delen van de hersenen tegelijk stimuleert. Al deze gebieden zijn belangrijk voor het ontwikkelen van spraak en taal.

De band die je opbouwt met je kind heeft ook een effect op andere gebieden van hun ontwikkeling. Dus het is niet verrassend dat er veel onderzoek is gedaan naar de voordelen van muziek voor bonding, emotionele ontwikkeling en vroege communicatie.

BabyBeats™ is zo ontwikkelt dat het alle zintuigen van je baby stimuleert tijdens leuke muzikale activiteiten. Op deze manier help je jouw kind bij het ontwikkelen van hun hersenen en vroege communicatie.

Dit samen vormt het fundament voor alle communicatie die jouw kind zal ontwikkelen gedurende zijn/haar peuter- en kleuterjaren.

De app bestaat uit 2 delen: ‘Baby’s’ en ‘Peuters’. Ga naar de ‘Baby’ sectie als uw baby nog heel jong is en hoorapparaten draagt, of als ze wachten op hun cochleaire implantaten.
Ga naar de ‘Peuter’ sectie als uw kind zijn/haar hoortoestellen of CI’s al langere tijd draagt.
summary: Early guidance program

title: LEO dictionary
description:
The application offers access to the LEO dictionaries, language courses and Survival Kits as well as the vocabulary trainer and forums.


Dictionaries


LEO’s online dictionaries are always up to date (no updates necessary).


★ English ⇔ German (814,000 entries)
★ French ⇔ German (261,000 entries)
★ Spanish ⇔ German (212,000 entries)
★ Italian ⇔ German (206,000 entries)
★ Chinese ⇔ German (199,000 entries)
★ Russian ⇔ German (314,000 entries)
★ Portuguese ⇔ German (103,000 entries)
★ Polish ⇔ German (70,000 entries)

With LEO you can do more than just look up the meaning of a word in a different language. LEO also provides:


☆ noun and verb tables
☆  real voice audio pronunciation (nospeech synthesis)
☆ definitions
☆ grammar and etymology,

as well as other information relevant to the search term(s) including


☆ orthographically similar words
☆ possible base forms for inflected words
☆ links to forum discussions containing the search term(s)


Language courses and Survival Kits


Learn a new language and find your way round in a new country. With LEO’s language courses and Survival Kits you can learn nine languages and find out about different customs and cultures – on your desktop or mobile device (also offline). The language courses and Survival Kits can be purchased within the app.



Vocabulary trainer


Use our free vocabulary trainer to create personal word lists and improve your vocabulary. We use a two-way synchronization method, which means you can access all your word lists on your mobile devices or on your desktop, all you need is a free account.



Forums


Connect with other users and get help with language-related questions that are not answered by the dictionary. To participate in the forums all you need is a free user account.


The app contains adverts which you can choose to remove by subscribing to our ad-free version.


For a detailed description of all features, please visit https://www.leo.org

recentChanges:
New forum layout
New dictionary: English-Spanish
Minor layout changes (e.g. login screen)
comments: Awesome application. I was wondering whether it would be possible in the trainer to be quizzed on all words of a certain word list. The application seems to support this: "Set the maximum number of words you want to be quizzed on in one drill session. If you would like to be quizzed on all words, leave the default setting all". But there's actually no way to select that "all" and the max limit is set to 100 words. Thanks.

It is the best dictionary I have ever seen. I have downloaded it for German, but it is also helpful for other languages like - French, Spanish etc. The app layout is awesome and easy to use. There is also a pronunciation tool which will tell you the pronunciation of any word in English as well as in the language the word belongs to. It will also show you conjugations, different forms of the word and phrases related to it. You can also take free online language courses.
Really friendly dictionary. More often than this I use the DuckDuckGo bang !leo in my browser.

Why does the widget have to be five slots wide and have all kinds of buttons on it? All I want is a little bar where I tap on it, then type in a word and get the translation displayed. This takes up too much space to use it. And why use the app at all then? I see no difference in placing the app icon somewhere in contrast to placing a shortcut to the homepage somewhere.
Translates stuff, ugly on tablets though

title: Cisco Webex Meetings
description:
Don’t let being away from the office slow your business down. Experience secure, productive meetings from wherever you are.

Cisco Webex Meetings delivers over 25 billion meetings per month, offering industry-leading video and audio conferencing with sharing, chat, and more. Experience why Webex Meetings is the most trusted video conferencing solution today.

General features: 
•	Join and present from any meeting, event, or training session
•	Hands-free voice commands with Google Assistant and Google Home Hub
•	Seamless joining directly from your calendar or customizable widget
•	Schedule meetings or playback recordings directly from your app
•	Customizable video layouts and virtual backgrounds
•	Share your screen to everyone

Want to learn more? See https://help.webex.com/nowvmhw/.

Follow us:
•	Twitter - https://twitter.com/webex
•	Facebook - https://www.facebook.com/CiscoCollab

By installing this application, you are accepting the Terms of Service (http://www.webex.com/terms-of-service-text.html) and Privacy Statement (https://www.cisco.com/web/siteassets/legal/privacy.html) and are consenting to receive communications, updates, and upgrades for Cisco Webex services. Cisco Webex may collect meeting usage data and personal information, such as your email address, from your computer or device.

What's New in Version 40.10?
•	Up to 25 grid view videos for Chromebooks and tablets
•	High FPS audio/video stream share support
•	Hard mute support 
•	Smart messaging if speaking while muted
•	Official Android R support
•	Usability improvements
•	Bug fixes 

Old information to be transferred to Collabhelp Usage Guide

REQUIREMENTS

Android OS 5.0+

Dual-core CPU is required for video.

Webex service is not available in all countries. See www.webex.com for information.

comments: App is decent for online meetings. I use it for group meetings as well as one on one collaboration. It is as good as zoom and some of the other platforms out there. I like that you can set the meeting to be open to anyone that has the link. unlike zoom the host doesn't have to add each individual to the meeting and you can also lock the meeting so no one else can get in if it's a private conversation, for instance an appointment with a therapist.

I was a first time user & was originally overwhelmed by all of the different options & directions. Also, I was attempting to use a "smart" phone which gave me limited screen usage. I would suggest that there be a test setup & a dummy call for novices; that way we can get practice before our actual conference call. We could also work out any kinks with our equipmemt. UPDATE: 6/17/20 I've used the system frequently over the past month. The system is a good option for those w/limited screen size.

I use this app for group virtual meetings at my government occupation. the app works wonderful, lots of video, audio, quality settings to chose from. my only issue would be that I had a great deal of difficulty initially learning how to join an active group. in fact I missed the first two meetings because I couldn't get it to work, and I am very technically proficient, from building barebones CPUs, html Java cyber security ect, and I still found the login to join meeting process very difficult.

As the parent of student, I've had to learn this app to support my child's education & I have to say, it's pretty decent. It could be a little less glitchy on audio. The video streamed rather smoothly. It wasn't exactly HDMI quality but it wasn't Commadore 64 pixelated either. There was a time delay of a few seconds with audio, that wasn't reflected in the video stream at all, when transitioning but it seemed as tho it would handle a few users at a time when speaking. Overall, very sufficient!

I have used Webex several times and have always been happy with the quality of voice and video. This time specially, there were some delays (5-10 seconds) on what presenter was sharing on his screen with attendees. He could see a new page, but we were still waiting to get it in our screen.
